poem:
The Water's Cry  

Water's ghostly waltz—  
veins of rivers run dry,  
or burst in wild froth.  
The world, a parched tongue,  
cracks its plea to the sky,  
a flood of silence spills.  
Raindrops yet to come  
are whispers in winds,  
a drink denied—  
or given in torrent's ire.
